00019 #ifndef _DECODE_EFR_HPP_cm131129_
00020 #define _DECODE_EFR_HPP_cm131129_
00021 
00022 #include <deque>
00023 #include <algorithm>
00024 
00025 #include <boost/noncopyable.hpp>
00026 #include <boost/shared_ptr.hpp>
00027 
00028 namespace decode {  
00029   class efr : public boost::noncopyable {
00030   public:
00031     typedef boost::shared_ptr<efr> sptr;    
00032     typedef std::deque<bool>           bit_vector_type;
00033     typedef std::vector<unsigned char> data_vector_type;
00034     typedef data_vector_type::const_iterator const_iterator;
00035 
00036     typedef enum {
00037       STATE_UNLOCKED,
00038       STATE_LOCKED,
00039       STATE_FINISH_PACKET
00040     } state_type;
00041 
00042     state_type get_state() const { return state_; }
00043     void set_state(state_type s) { state_ = s; }
00044 
00045     bool data_ok() const { return data_ok_; }
00046     const data_vector_type& data() const { return data_; }
00047     const_iterator begin() const { return data_.begin(); }
00048     const_iterator end() const { return data_.end(); }
00049 
00050     static sptr make() {
00051       return sptr(new efr());
00052     }
00053 
00054     void push_back(bool bit) {
00055       bits_.push_back(bit);
00056       switch (get_state()) {
00057       case STATE_UNLOCKED:
00058         data_.clear();
00059         data_ok_ = false;
00060         if (bits_.size() == 44) {
00061 #if 0
00062           std::cout << "D ";
00063           std::copy(bits_.begin(),    bits_.begin()+11, std::ostream_iterator<bool>(std::cout, ""));
00064           std::cout << "\nD ";
00065           std::copy(bits_.begin()+33, bits_.begin()+44, std::ostream_iterator<bool>(std::cout, ""));
00066           std::cout << "\nS ";
00067           std::copy(start_sequence(), start_sequence()+11, std::ostream_iterator<bool>(std::cout, ""));
00068           std::cout << std::endl;
00069           std::cout << "TESTs: "
00070                     << std::equal(bits_.begin(),    bits_.begin()+11, start_sequence()) << " "
00071                     << std::equal(bits_.begin()+11, bits_.begin()+22, bits_.begin()+22) << " "
00072                     << std::equal(bits_.begin()+33, bits_.begin()+44, start_sequence()) << std::endl;
00073 
00074 #endif
00075           if (std::equal(bits_.begin(),    bits_.begin()+11, start_sequence()) &&
00076               std::equal(bits_.begin()+11, bits_.begin()+22, bits_.begin()+22) &&
00077               std::equal(bits_.begin()+33, bits_.begin()+44, start_sequence())) {
00078             const std::pair<unsigned char, bool> len1(decode_line(bits_.begin()+11));
00079             const std::pair<unsigned char, bool> len2(decode_line(bits_.begin()+22));
00080 #if 0
00081             std::cout << "D found start: length = "
00082                       << int(len1.first) << " "
00083                       << int(len2.first) << " "
00084                       << len1.second << "," << len2.second
00085                       << std::endl;
00086 #endif
00087             if (len1.second && len2.second && len1.first == len2.first) {
00088               len_ = len1.first;
00089               for (size_t i(0); i<44; ++i)
00090                 bits_.pop_front();
00091               set_state(STATE_LOCKED);
00092               break;
00093             }
00094           }
00095           if (get_state() == STATE_UNLOCKED)
00096             bits_.pop_front();
00097         }
00098         break;
00099       case STATE_LOCKED:
00100         if (bits_.size() == 11) {
00101           const std::pair<unsigned char, bool> b(decode_line(bits_.begin()));
00102           if (not b.second)
00103             set_state(STATE_UNLOCKED);
00104           else {
00105             if (data_.size() < len_)  {
00106               data_.push_back(b.first);
00107             } else {
00108 #if 0
00109               std::cout << "D checksum: "
00110                         << (std::accumulate(data_.begin(), data_.end(), 0) % 256) << " == " << int(b.first) << std::endl;
00111 #endif
00112               if (std::accumulate(data_.begin(), data_.end(), 0) % 256 == b.first) {
00113 #if 0
00114                 std::cout << "D data= ";
00115                 std::copy(data_.begin(), data_.end(), std::ostream_iterator<int>(std::cout, " "));
00116                 std::cout << std::endl;
00117 #endif
00118                 set_state(STATE_FINISH_PACKET);
00119               }
00120             }
00121             bits_.clear();
00122           }
00123         }
00124         break;
00125       case STATE_FINISH_PACKET:
00126         if (bits_.size() == 11) {
00127           if (std::equal(bits_.begin(), bits_.begin()+11, finish_sequence())) {
00128 #if 0
00129             std::cout << "D everything OK!\n";
00130 #endif
00131             data_ok_ = true;
00132           }
00133           set_state(STATE_UNLOCKED);
00134           bits_.clear();
00135         }
00136         break;
00137       default:
00138         ;
00139       }
00140     }
00141 
00142   protected:
00143     std::pair<unsigned char, bool> decode_line(bit_vector_type::const_iterator i) {
00144       // i[0]==0 and parity check
00145       // std::cout << "decode_line: ";
00146       // std::copy(i, i+11, std::ostream_iterator<bool>(std::cout, ""));
00147       // std::cout << "\ndecode_line: " << (*i) << " " << std::accumulate(i+1, i+9, 0) << " " << *(i+9) << std::endl;
00148       if ((*i != 0) ||
00149           (std::accumulate(i+1, i+9, 0) % 2) != *(i+9))
00150         return std::make_pair(0, false);
00151       // bits -> 8 bit number
00152       unsigned char data(0);
00153       unsigned char p(1);
00154       for (bit_vector_type::const_iterator j(i+1); j<i+9; ++j) {
00155         data |= (*j * p);
00156         p <<= 1;        
00157       }
00158       return std::make_pair(data, true);
00159     }
00160 
00161   private: 
00162     efr()
00163       : state_(STATE_UNLOCKED)
00164       , data_ok_(false) {}
00165 
00166     static bool* start_sequence() {
00167       static bool start_bits[11]  = { 0, 0,0,0,1,0,1,1,0, 1,1 };
00168       return start_bits;
00169     }
00170     static bool* finish_sequence() {
00171       static bool finish_bits[11] = { 0, 0,1,1,0,1,0,0,0, 1,1 };
00172       return finish_bits;
00173     }
00174 
00175     state_type       state_;
00176     bit_vector_type  bits_;
00177     bit_vector_type  start_sequence_;
00178     size_t           len_; // length of packet;
00179     data_vector_type data_; // extracted bytes
00180     bool             data_ok_;
00181   } ;
00182 
00183 } // namespace decode
00184 #endif // _DECODE_EFR_HPP_cm131129_
